Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ursodeoxycholic Acid for Gallstone Prevention Post-Gastrectomy

Participants.evidence: Adults (≥19 years) with gastric cancer undergoing gastrectomy were enrolled from May 26, 2015, to January 9, 2017.

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1:1 to receive 300 mg UDCA, 600 mg UDCA, or placebo daily for 52 weeks

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) in preventing gallstone formation in gastric cancer patients post-gastrectomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was gallstone formation within 12 months, assessed by ultrasonography.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation used a stratified block method, and allocation was concealed via an interactive web-response system.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included participants, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 465 were analysed (151 in 300 mg group, 164 in 600 mg group, 150 in placebo group) using intention-to-treat.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse reactions were reported. The most common adverse event was nausea (0.8%), with no serious adverse reactions.
